class_notes:
(Same as ANCMED 202R 1) - You must have permission to enroll in-person.


The course focuses on the ancient Greek experience of health and healing from Homer through the Hellenistic era (roughly 8th through lst centuries BCE).  A major theme of the seminar will be understanding the contemporaneous emergence and continued success of Hippocratic medicine and Asclepian religion/cult, two distinct but related ways of thinking about health and healing.  Emphasis will be on primary sources, both texts such as Hippocratic writings and testimonia of Asclepius' healing, and on archaeological and material evidence from the sanctuaries of Asclepius located throughout the Greek world.
course_description: The course demonstrates how literary, artistic, and/or cinematic texts, when understood in relation to the context of their production, can be used to study selected historical themes.
